results.prompt_sent: I'm starting work on a dark mode feature for our app. Set up everything I need to track this work: create a project for it, then create a workunit inside that project for the implementation work. The workunit should have a clear problem statement and success criteria that you derive from the feature context.

arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature Implementation
arguments.description: Project to implement dark mode feature for the app, improving user experience in low-light environments.

tool_calls.name: create_workunit

arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature Implementation
arguments.problem_statement: Current app interface causes eye strain in low-light conditions, reducing user satisfaction and engagement. Implementing a dark mode feature will improve visual comfort and accessibility for users in dim environments.
arguments.success_criteria: Dark mode feature is fully implemented, tested, and deployed to production with at least 80% of users actively using the dark mode setting within 30 days of launch, as tracked by in-app analytics.

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Develop a notification system that alerts users when their workunits are updated, ensuring timely communication without overwhelming users.
arguments.success_criteria: Users receive real-time notifications for workunit updates via email and in-app messages; system handles rate limiting to prevent spam; notifications are configurable by user role.

results.prompt_sent: We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

arguments.title: Switched to WebSockets for real-time notifications
arguments.content: We chose WebSockets over polling to achieve real-time notifications with lower latency. Tradeoffs considered: WebSockets require more server resources and complex infrastructure setup but provide immediate updates without polling overhead. Polling is simpler but results in higher latency and increased server load due to frequent requests.

results.task_name: Create a project with linked asset
results.prompt_sent: Set up a new project called "API v2" for our REST API redesign work. This project will be tracked in our GitHub repo at github.com/example/api-v2 on the main branch. Also create a knowledge asset called "API v2 Design Spec" and link it to the project — it's a document describing the new API design.
